packages.description:
## Package Overview

This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with WebSocket endpoints. The package facilitates three types of network entry points as ‘Client’, ‘AsyncClient’, and ‘Listener’.

The `websocket:Client` reads text and binary messages synchronously. A callback service with the two `onPing` and `onPong` remote functions can be registered at the initialization of the client to receive `ping/pong` control frames.
The `websocket:AsyncClient`, which behaves asynchronously also has a callback `websocket:Service` that can be registered at the initialization of the client. It has a fixed set of remote methods in this service and they get called on the receipt of messages from the server. 

On the server-side, an initial WebSocket service is there to handle upgrade requests. It has a single `get` resource, which takes in an `http:Request` optionally. The `get` resource returns a `websocket:Service` to which incoming messages get dispatched after a successful WebSocket connection upgrade. This resource can be used to intercept the initial HTTP upgrade with custom headers or to cancel the WebSocket upgrade by returning an error.
The returning `websocket:Service` has a fixed set of remote methods.

**WebSocket upgrade**: During a WebSocket upgrade, the initial message received is an HTTP request. 

```ballerina
service /ws on new websocket:Listener(21003) {
    resource function get .(http:Request req) returns websocket:Service|websocket:UpgradeError {
        return new WsService();
}
        
service class WsService {
  *websocket:Service;
  remote isolated function onTextMessage(websocket:Caller caller, string data) returns websocket:Error? {
      check caller->writeTextMessage(data);
  }
}              
```

### Remote methods associated with `websocket:Service`

**onOpen**: As soon as the WebSocket handshake is completed and the connection is established, the `onOpen` remote method is dispatched.

**onTextMessage**: The received text messages are dispatched to this remote method.

**onBinaryMessage**: The received binary messages are dispatched to this remote method.

**onPing and onPong**: The received ping and pong messages are dispatched to these remote methods respectively.

**onIdleTimeout**: This remote method is dispatched when the idle timeout is reached. The `idleTimeout` has to be configured either in the WebSocket service or the client configuration.

**onClose**: This remote method is dispatched when a close frame with a statusCode and a reason is received.

**onError**: This remote method is dispatched when an error occurs in the WebSocket connection. This will always be preceded by a connection closure with an appropriate close frame.

### Remote methods associated with `websocket:Client` service

**onPing**: The received `ping` messages are dispatched to this remote method.

**onPong**: The received `pong` messages are dispatched to this remote method.

For more information, see the following.
* [Server Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/websocket-basic-sample.html)
* [Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/websocket-text-client.html) 
* [Async Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/websocket-async-text-client.html)

fields.name: retryConfig
fields.description: Retry related configurations

records.name: ClientConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations for the WebSocket client.
Following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the Client specific
configs.

|                                                                              |
|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| callbackService - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration             |
| subProtocols - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| customHeaders - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration               |
| idleTimeoutInSeconds - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration        |
| secureSocket - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| maxFrameSize - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| webSocketCompressionEnabled - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration |
| handShakeTimeoutInSeconds - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration   |
| cookies - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                     |

fields.name: subProtocols
fields.description: Negotiable sub protocols of the client

fields.name: customHeaders
fields.description: Custom headers, which should be sent to the server

fields.name: idleTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Idle timeout of the client. Upon timeout, the `onIdleTimeout` resource (if defined)
                         of the client service will be triggered

fields.name: readTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Read timeout of the client. This is applicable only for the Sync client

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: SSL/TLS-related options

fields.name: maxFrameSize
fields.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes
                 If this is not set, is negative, or is zero, the default frame size of 65536 will be used.

fields.name: webSocketCompressionEnabled
fields.description: Enable support for compression in the WebSocket

fields.name: handShakeTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Time (in seconds) that a connection waits to get the response of
                              the webSocket handshake. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated with
                              an error.If the value < 0, then the value sets to the default value(300).

records.name: CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration
records.description: Common client configurations for WebSocket clients.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The host name/IP of the endpoint

fields.name: http1Settings
fields.description: Configurations related to HTTP/1.x protocol

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description:
The SSL configurations for the service endpoint. This needs to be configured in order to
                 communicate through WSS.

fields.name: timeoutInMillis
fields.description:
Period of time in milliseconds that a connection waits for a read/write operation in the
                    initial upgrade request. Use value 0 to disable timeout

fields.name: server
fields.description: The server name which should appear as a response header

fields.name: webSocketCompressionEnabled
fields.description: Enable support for compression in WebSocket

fields.name: requestLimits
fields.description: Configurations associated with inbound request size limits

records.name: ListenerConfiguration
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for HTTP service endpoints.

fields.name: keepAlive
fields.description:
Can be set to either `KEEPALIVE_AUTO`, which respects the `connection` header, or `KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS`,
              which always keeps the connection alive, or `KEEPALIVE_NEVER`, which always closes the connection

fields.name: maxPipelinedRequests
fields.description:
Defines the maximum number of requests that can be processed at a given time on a single
                         connection. By default 10 requests can be pipelined on a single cinnection and user can
                         change this limit appropriately.

records.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
records.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

fields.name: trustStore
fields.description: Configures the trust store to be used

fields.name: keyStore
fields.description: Configures the key store to be used

fields.name: certFile
fields.description: A file containing the certificate of the server

fields.name: keyFile
fields.description: A file containing the private key of the server

fields.name: keyPassword
fields.description: Password of the private key if it is encrypted

fields.name: trustedCertFile
fields.description: A file containing a list of certificates or a single certificate that the server trusts

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: SSL/TLS protocol related options

fields.name: certValidation
fields.description: Certificate validation against CRL or OCSP related options

fields.name: ciphers
fields.description:
List of ciphers to be used (e.g.: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,
            TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA)

fields.name: sslVerifyClient
fields.description: The type of client certificate verification. (e.g.: "require" or "optional")

fields.name: shareSession
fields.description: Enable/disable new SSL session creation

fields.name: handshakeTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: SSL handshake time out

fields.name: sessionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: SSL session time out

fields.name: ocspStapling
fields.description: Enable/disable OCSP stapling

records.name: ListenerSecureSocket
records.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The local host name/IP

fields.name: port
fields.description: The local port

records.name: Local
records.description: Presents a read-only view of the local address.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The remote host IP

fields.name: port
fields.description: The remote port

records.name: Remote
records.description: Presents a read-only view of the remote address.

fields.name: maxUriLength
fields.description:
Maximum allowed length for a URI. Exceeding this limit will result in a `414 - URI Too Long`
                 response

fields.name: maxHeaderSize
fields.description:
Maximum allowed size for headers. Exceeding this limit will result in a
                  `431 - Request Header Fields Too Large` response

fields.name: maxEntityBodySize
fields.description:
Maximum allowed size for the entity body. By default it is set to -1 which means there
                      is no restriction `maxEntityBodySize`, On the Exceeding this limit will result in a
                      `413 - Payload Too Large` response

records.name: RequestLimitConfigs
records.description: Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

fields.name: targetUrls
fields.description: The set of URLs, which are used to connect to the server

fields.name: failoverIntervalInMillis
fields.description: The maximum number of milliseconds to delay a failover attempt

records.name: WebSocketFailoverClientConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations for the WebSocket client endpoint.

|                                                                              |
|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| callbackService - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration             |
| subProtocols - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| customHeaders - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration               |
| idleTimeoutInSeconds - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration        |
| secureSocket - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| maxFrameSize - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |
| webSocketCompressionEnabled - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration |
| handShakeTimeoutInSeconds - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration   |
| cookieConfig - Copied from CommonWebSocketClientConfiguration                |

fields.name: maxCount
fields.description: The maximum number of retry attempts. If the count is zero, the client will retry indefinitely

fields.name: intervalInMillis
fields.description: The number of milliseconds to delay before attempting to reconnect

fields.name: backOffFactor
fields.description:
The rate of increase of the reconnect delay. Allows reconnect attempts to back off when problems
               persist

fields.name: maxWaitIntervalInMillis
fields.description: Maximum time of the retry interval in milliseconds

fields.name: subProtocols
fields.description: Negotiable sub protocol by the service

fields.name: idleTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Idle timeout for the client connection. Upon timeout, `onIdleTimeout` resource (if defined)
                         in the server service will be triggered. Note that this overrides the `timeoutInMillis` config
                         in the `websocket:Listener` which is applicable only for the initial HTTP upgrade request.

fields.name: maxFrameSize
fields.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes.
                 If this is not set or is negative or zero, the default frame size which is 65536 will be used.

abstractObjects.name: ClientService
abstractObjects.description: The Websocket Sync client service type

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeTextMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Writes text to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeBinaryMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Writes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: ping
remoteMethods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: pong
remoteMethods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeoutInSeconds
parameters.description:
Time to wait for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
                  connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
                  is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
                  waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
                  endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description: Closes the connection.

parameters.name: callbackService
parameters.description:
The callback service of the client. Resources in this service gets called on the
                    receipt of messages from the server

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the client

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the client when called.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

will be lost.

that message will be lost.

Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: timeoutInSeconds
parameters.description:
Time to wait for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
                  connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
                  is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
                  waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
                  endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection

methods.description: Closes the connection.

parameters.description: The key, which identifies the attribute

methods.description: Sets a connection-related attribute.

parameters.description: The key to identify the attribute

returnParameters.description: The attribute related to the given key or `nil`

methods.description: Gets connection-related attributes if any.

methods.description: Gives the secured status of the connection.

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is open

methods.description: Gives the open or closed status of the connection.

returnParameters.description: The HTTP response received from the client handshake request

methods.description: Gives the HTTP response if any received for the client handshake request.

otherMethods.description: Gives the subprotocol if any that is negotiated with the client.

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is secure

otherMethods.name: isSecure
otherMethods.description: Gives the secured status of the connection.

returnParameters.description: `true` if the connection is open

otherMethods.name: isOpen
otherMethods.description: Gives the open or closed status of the connection.

returnParameters.description: The HTTP response received from the client handshake request

otherMethods.name: getHttpResponse
otherMethods.description: Gives the HTTP response if any received for the client handshake request.

clients.name: Client
clients.description: Represents a WebSocket synchronous client endpoint.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data to be sent. If it is a byte[], it is converted to a UTF-8 string for sending

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeTextMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes text to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeBinaryMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: ping
remoteMethods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the connection, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: pong
remoteMethods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeoutInSeconds
parameters.description:
Time to wait for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
                  connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
                  is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
                  waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
                  endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs while closing the webSocket connection

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description: Closes the connection.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the   failover client, which provides failover capabilities to a WebSocket client endpoint.

                  waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote

clients.name: WebSocketFailoverClient
clients.description: A WebSocket client endpoint, which provides failover support for multiple WebSocket targets.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service that needs to be attached

returnParameters.description: An `error` an error occurred during the service attachment process or else nil

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description: Attaches a service to the listener.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener starting process

methods.name: 'start
methods.description: Starts the registered service programmatically.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener stopping process

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener gracefully. Already-accepted requests will be served before connection closure.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener stop process

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener immediately. It is not implemented yet.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service that needs to be attached

returnParameters.description: An `error` an error occurred during the service attachment process or else nil

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches a service to the listener.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if one occurred during detaching of a service or else `()`

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Detaches a Http or WebSocket service from the listener. Note that detaching a WebSocket service would not affect
The functionality of the existing connections.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations for the websocket service listener

methods.name: init
methods.description: Gets invoked during module initialization to initialize the listener.

otherMethods.description: Stops the service listener gracefully. Already-accepted requests will be served before connection closure.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener stop process

otherMethods.name: immediateStop
otherMethods.description: Stops the service listener immediately. It is not implemented yet.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if one occurred during detaching of a service or else `()`

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description:
Detaches a Http or WebSocket service from the listener. Note that detaching a WebSocket service would not affect
The functionality of the existing connections.

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
This is used for creating Websocket server endpoints. An Websocket server endpoint is capable of responding to
remote callers. The `Listener` is responsible for initializing the endpoint using the provided configurations.

constants.name: KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS
constants.description: Keeps the connection alive irrespective of the `connection` header value }

constants.name: KEEPALIVE_AUTO
constants.description: Decides to keep the connection alive or not based on the `connection` header of the client request }

constants.name: KEEPALIVE_NEVER
constants.description: Closes the connection irrespective of the `connection` header value }

constants.name: REQUEST_METHOD
constants.description: Constant for the request method reference.

constants.name: RESOURCE_NAME
constants.description: Constant for the resource name reference.

constants.name: SERVICE_NAME
constants.description: Constant for the service name reference.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation which is used to configure a WebSocket service.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: The union of all the WebSocket related errors

errors.name: HandshakeTimedOut
errors.description: Raised when the initial WebSocket handshake timed out

errors.name: ReadTimedOutError
errors.description: Raised when the client creation fails

errors.name: UpgradeError
errors.description: Raised when the websocket upgrade is not accepted

errors.name: WsConnectionClosureError
errors.description: Raised during failures in connection closure

errors.name: WsGenericClientError
errors.description: Raised when the client creation fails

errors.name: WsGenericError
errors.description: Raised for errors not captured by the specific errors

errors.name: WsInvalidContinuationFrameError
errors.description: Raised when an out of order/invalid continuation frame is received

errors.name: WsInvalidHandshakeError
errors.description: Raised during the handshake when the WebSocket upgrade fails

errors.name: WsPayloadTooBigError
errors.description: Raised when receiving a frame with a payload exceeding the maximum size

errors.name: WsProtocolError
errors.description: Raised when the other side breaks the protocol

types.name: KeepAlive
types.description: Defines the possible values for the keep-alive configuration in service and client endpoints.

packages.name: websocket
packages.summary: This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with WebSocket endpoints. The package facilitates three types of network entry points as ‘Client’, ‘AsyncClient’, and ‘Listener’.
